item.title: Digimon Story: Time Stranger ‘Deep Dive with Producer Ryosuke Hara’ video
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

A nine-minute introduction.

Publisher Bandai Namco and developer Media.Vision have released a nine-minute gameplay deep dive for Digimon Story: Time Stranger with producer Ryosuke Hara.

Here is an overview of the game, via Bandai Namco:

About

Digimon Story: Time Stranger is an RPG with monster-taming elements that explores the deep bond between humans and Digimon in an epic story that unravels the mystery of the world’s collapse.

Embark on an adventure that spans across the human world and Digital World, collecting and raising a diverse array of Digimon to fight in turn-based battles.

Key Features

  • An Epic Story of Connection – Tokyo, Japan. An agent of a secret organization encounters an unknown creature shortly before a city-leveling explosion. They then reawaken eight years in the past… Take on a mission to uncover the mystery of the world’s collapse, where chance encounters with unique characters will shape your journey across time and parallel worlds—and change fate itself.
  • Adventure Between Worlds and Time – Journey between the parallel human world and the Digital World: Iliad where Digimon reside. See the Digital World and its intricately detailed realms like never before, with interactive elements and special quests to explore.
  • Strategic Turn-Based Battles – Enjoy dynamic turn-based combat that combines strategic elements with evolved battle components. More than 450 Digimon and deep customization options provide limitless ways to approach the challenges of battle and reveal the strength of the bonds formed with your Digimon.

Digimon Story: Time Stranger is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam on October 3.

item.title: Towa and the Guardians of the Sacred Tree ‘Guardians’ trailer – Nishiki and Rekka
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Protect the village with the help of Guardian companions.

Publisher Bandai Namco and developer Brownies have released a new trailer for roguelite action game Towa and the Guardians of the Sacred Tree introducing the Guardians Nishiki and Rekka.

Here is an overview of the game, via Bandai Namco:

About

A new roguelike where bonds, blades, and bravery decide the fate of all.

In a far-off mystic realm, ancient forces stir, and untold dangers await.

In this roguelite adventure set in a far-off mystic realm, ancient forces stir, and untold dangers await. As Towa, lead the guardians of the sacred tree in forging strong relationships and powerful swords to fight Magatsu’s forces and determine the future of Shinju Village.

Key Features

  • Enter a Vibrant World Filled With Beauty and Perilous Danger – On their quest to restore peace, play as Towa and the Guardians as they explore far-off lands threatened by Magatsu’s evil influence. In a world where even splendor hides a lurking threat, courage is the only way forward. As Hitoshi Sakimoto’s melodies guide the way, a breathtaking yet untamed landscape unfolds where the fight to save Shinju Village begins.
  • Fight as a Duo in a Thrilling Roguelite Combat – Towa, priestess of Shinju, stands united with eight trustworthy companions to defeat Magatsu. Fight alongside a fellow guardian and wield the power of the sacred sword (Tsurugi) and staff (Kagura). Each guardian has its own abilities and set of swords, making each combat style and guardian pair unique. Together, pave your way through colorful lands, conquer dungeons, and defeat Magatsu’s minions!
  • Forge Weapons and Bonds That Stand the Test of Time – As the guardians pursue their quests across different timelines, the village evolves over the years. Develop unique bonds with its residents and learn more about their customs and stories that are woven into the inner workings of the village. Each visit is a chance to train at the dojo, summon powerful Graces, and craft new swords at the smithing shop.

Towa and the Guardians of the Sacred Tree is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam on September 19.
